devdoc.author: Juan Castellon
devdoc.details: TokenFactory is a factory pattern implemented via a Library, that  will be used to create new tokens. It will basically conglomerate all the logic related to tokens creation and it's business rules.  At the moment creates instances for every request without any  validation, but the plan is to add all business rules here to create  tokens.

createTokenForCompany(CompanyFactory.Dat.details: This function will create a token on the Platform. It will first validate that who is trying to create this token is the owner of the company. If it is the owner, then it will search for a position  available in the tokens array. If an available position is found,  then it will create a new Token instance and add it to the tokens array of that company.

params.aCompany: address of the company that wants to create this token.
params.aName: string with the name of the token.
params.aSymbol: string with a 3 chars (aprox) token symbol.
params.initialAmount: uint256 with initial supply for this token.
params.self: This function will receive the object (where the data is  stored) they are called on as their first parameter.

findCompanyownerUtil(CompanyFactory.Data.details: This is a util function to expose the functionality of an internal function. Only for development purposes.

params.aCompany: address of the company to search owner.
params.self: This function will receive the object (where the data is  stored) they are called on as their first parameter.

findCompanyownerUtil(CompanyFactory.Data.return: address of the company owner, or 0x if not found.

devdoc.title: Library to create tokens on the platform

findCompanyownerUtil(CompanyFactory.Data.notice: remove this function before going to MAINNET.
